name: Social Proof Badges on Trending Items
description: Test hypothesis that social proof indicators increase conversion for first-time visitors

inputs.featureIdea: Display 'Popular', 'Trending', and 'X people viewing' badges on product listings for items with high engagement

expectedHypothesis.statement: We believe displaying social proof badges ('Popular', 'Trending', 'X viewing now') for first-time visitors will increase conversion rate from 0.8% to 1.1% (37% relative increase). We'll know we're right when first-time visitor purchase rate shows statistically significant improvement.
assumptions: Badges are not perceived as manipulative
risks: Non-badged items become less attractive (negative contrast)
Privacy concerns from 'X people viewing' tracking

secondary: Share of purchases on badged items
counter: Brand trust score (watch for manipulation perception)
Non-badged item conversion rate (watch for negative contrast)

treatmentGroups.name: Treatment A - Static badges only
treatmentGroups.description: Popular and Trending badges only (no real-time)

treatmentGroups.name: Treatment B - All badges
treatmentGroups.description: Popular, Trending, and 'X viewing now' badges

experimentDesignNotes.note: Consider multi-arm test to isolate real-time vs. static social proof effects
